name: The Medica
tagline: The healing arts, older than memory
overview: The Medica is synonymous with the healing arts and is among the oldest organizations in the Realms. It operates as part of the Guild of Apothecaries and Physicians, which itself belongs to a larger collective of academic and artisanal institutions called the Arcanum. At the Medica, acolytes study herbal medicine while also learning to tend to the sick.

joining.title: Joining the Medica
requirements: Be proficient with a herbalism kit
Make a contribution of any amount
joining.note: Scholarships are often available to those from disadvantaged backgrounds.

ranks.name: Novice
ranks.title: Novice
benefits: Recognized as a novice of the Arcanum
+1 bonus to checks to create curative medicines

ranks.name: Seeker
ranks.title: Seeker
benefits: +1 bonus to checks for an additional medicine category of your choice
Can undertake guild work as a downtime activity
ranks.exam: Any 2-star medicine from a category of your choice

ranks.name: Emerald Seer
ranks.title: Emerald Seer
benefits: +1 bonus to checks for an additional medicine category of your choice
ranks.exam: Any 3-star medicine from a category of your choice
ranks.note: Advancement may require sponsorship by a senior member

ranks.name: Emerald Speaker
ranks.title: Emerald Speaker
benefits: +1 bonus to checks for an additional medicine category of your choice
Can undertake research projects as a downtime activity
ranks.exam: Any 4-star medicine from a category of your choice
ranks.note: Advancement may require sponsorship by a senior member

ranks.name: Master Physic
ranks.title: Master Physic
benefits: Recognized as an Arcanist of the Arcanum
+1 bonus to checks for your final medicine category
Can create medicines with indefinite duration (✧)
ranks.exam: Any 5-star medicine from the remaining category
ranks.note: Advancement may require sponsorship by a senior member

guildMerchant.title: Guild Merchant
guildMerchant.overview: Members of novice rank and above can purchase medicines and components directly from the Guild.

components.description: Each component has a cost and a stock score. The higher an item's stock score, the less likely it will be available.
components.mechanic: Roll your stock die (based on rank). You can purchase components with a combined stock score equal to or lower than the number rolled.
components.replenish: Component stocks are replenished daily at dawn. Reroll your stock die each day you visit.

finishedItems.description: Any character in good standing can purchase finished items.
finishedItems.limit: Each day, purchase medicines with combined strength equal to or lower than your proficiency bonus.

selling.description: Merchants purchase items at 20% of normal sale price. Better offers may be found through downtime activities.

activities.name: Communal Work
activities.description: Spend time tending to the sick and the poor.
activities.benefit: Gain favor with senior members, make local connections, and other benefits.

activities.name: Studying
activities.description: Attend classes in preparation for sitting an exam.
activities.benefit: If you complete a full term's tuition, make your exam check with advantage.

activities.name: Guild Work
activities.description: Fill orders in the Crucible (a great workshop).
activities.benefit: Earn money based on your rank. All equipment and materials supplied.
activities.complication: 10% chance per workweek of a complication arising.

activities.name: Research
activities.description: Pursue research projects to improve existing medicines or develop new ones.
activities.benefit: Same earnings as guild work, but no risk of complications.
activities.duration: Takes workweeks equal to the new item's strength.

complications.result: Customer cancels order, reducing earnings by one rank
Secure a lucrative contract, increasing earnings by one rank
Tools damaged or stolen, must buy new ones
Blamed for an incident, barred from crucible for 1d6 weeks
Accused of theft, barred from guild merchant until cleared

exams.title: Guild Exams
exams.description: Exams take place at the end of every month. They are invigilated by a master and take 2 hours, during which all magic is suppressed as if in an antimagic field.
process: Enroll for the term and pay tuition cost
Supply your own craft components (can buy from guild stocks)
Make a craft check using your herbalism kit
If you attended full tuition, make the check with advantage
On success, your new rank is immediately recognized
exams.note: Items created during exams are withheld by the Guild to supplement stocks.

medicineCategories.title: Medicine Categories

categories.name: Fortifying
categories.description: Protects against damage and harmful effects

categories.name: Restorative
categories.description: Restores hit points and expended resources

medicineCategories.craftingNote: Creating a medicine requires 1 hour of uninterrupted work, which can be performed during a short or long rest. Use your proficiency bonus + Intelligence or Wisdom modifier (your choice).

tips.title: Guild Politics
tips.text: The Medica is part of the larger Arcanum. Senior members may have conflicting agendas, and advancement often depends on more than just skill.

tips.title: Story Hooks
tips.text: Use communal work to introduce NPCs, guild work complications for drama, and the exam system for milestone moments.

tips.title: Medicine as Leverage
tips.text: In dock communities, access to healing is power. The Medica's services can be withheld, traded, or used as political tools.

tips.title: Meilin's Position
tips.text: As a Seeker, Meilin can use workshops unsupervised and take guild work. She's building toward Emerald Seer, which requires sponsorship.
